text.p: Safeskin Corp, a maker of medical gloves, on Wednesday said it has won a $120 million, six-year contract to supply Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp with all its latex examination gloves.

Columbia, the largest provider of health care services in the United States, operates a network of facilities including hospitals, surgery centers, home health locations and nationwide pharmacy benefit management.
Safeskin shares were up 1-3/4 to 23-1/2 by mid-afternoon.
In addition to the contract, Safeskin also reported first quarter earnings of $0.30 a share versus $0.20 one year ago.
The earnings were above analysts' consensus estimate of $0.27 per share, according to investment research firm First Call.
Safeskin's first quarter net income rose to $8.5 million on sales of $41.2 million from $5.5 million on sales of $33.1 million in the year ago first quarter.
